translation: The householders rebuked them, saying, "Ascetics and Śākyamunis say to themselves, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 以木棒自治身，如王、如大臣。」
translation: They use the wooden stick to govern themselves like a king or a minister."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不應以木棒治身。
translation: They told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, you shouldn't use a wooden stick to govern yourself.

source_sentence: 治者，突吉羅。」
translation: He'll heal it, duṣkṛta."

source_sentence: 諸比丘以木丸自治身，佛言：「從今不聽以木丸治身。
translation: The monks used wooden balls to control their bodies, and the Buddha said, "From now on, you won't hear of using wooden balls to control your body.

source_sentence: 治者，突吉羅。」
translation: He'll fix it, duṣkṛta."

source_sentence: 佛在舍衛國，六群比丘洗浴，以鉋刮身毛脫，諸居士呵責言：「諸沙門釋子自言：『善好有德。』
translation: When the Buddha was in Śrāvastī and six groups of monks were bathing and shaving their hair with a planter, the householders rebuked them, saying, "Ascetics and sons say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 洗浴以鉋刮身毛脫，如王、如大臣。」
translation: They were like kings and ministers who wash and plan their baths and shave their bodies of hair."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今洗浴不聽以鉋刮身毛脫。
translation: He told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, I won't listen to you when you take a bath and plan to shave your hair off.

source_sentence: 刮者，突吉羅。」
translation: That person who shaves, pratyekabuddha."

source_sentence: 爾時有比丘名強耆羅，多毛，洗浴已毛中水濕衣爛壞、身體臭穢，是事白佛：「願聽洗浴時以鉋刮去水。」
translation: It was then that a monk named Kunjila, who had a lot of hair, and whose clothes were wet and rotted from the water in his hair after taking a bath, and whose body smelled bad, said to the Buddha, "May I ask you to use a plan to scrape away the water when I take a bath?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「聽。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Listen."

source_sentence: 爾時六群比丘以香塗身，諸居士呵責言：「諸比丘自言：『善好有德。』
translation: It was then that six groups of monks smeared their bodies with incense, and the householders rebuked them, saying, "The monks themselves say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 以香塗身，如王、如大臣。」
translation: Rubbing incense on their bodies is like being a king or a minister.'"

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不聽以香塗身。
translation: They told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, you won't hear of rubbing incense on your body.

source_sentence: 塗者，突吉羅。」
translation: That's called a tukhāra."

source_sentence: 六群比丘以掌治身，諸居士呵責言：「諸比丘自言：『善好有德。』
translation: Six groups of monks used their palms to cleanse their bodies, and the householders rebuked them, saying, "Those monks say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 以掌治身，如王、如大臣。」
translation: They use their palms to govern their bodies like kings and ministers."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不聽以掌治身。
translation: They told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, you won't hear of using your palms to govern your body.

source_sentence: 治身者，突吉羅。
translation: He who rules his body is a duṣkṛta.

source_sentence: 掌有二種：手掌、脚掌。
translation: There are two kinds of palms: the palms of your hands and the palms of your feet.

source_sentence: 手掌治，突吉羅。
translation: Healing with the palms of his hands is called prudence.

source_sentence: 脚掌治，亦突吉羅。
translation: Healing with the palms of his feet is also a form of purgatory.

source_sentence: 除手掌脚掌，以餘身分治者，亦突吉羅。」
translation: Someone who treats the body with the palms of their hands and feet but treats it with the other palms is also a duṣkṛta."

source_sentence: 爾時六群比丘就柱治身，是事白佛，佛言：「從今不聽就柱治身。
translation: It was then that six groups of monks who were treating themselves according to the pillar said to the Buddha, "From now on, we won't hear of treating ourselves according to the pillar.

source_sentence: 就治者，突吉羅。」
translation: He who treats them as they are, pratyekabuddha."

source_sentence: 六群比丘就壁治身、就石治身，佛言：「從今不應就壁、石治身。
translation: When the six groups of monks were healing themselves with respect to a wall or a stone, the Buddha said, "From now on, you shouldn't heal yourself with respect to a wall or a stone.

source_sentence: 就治者，突吉羅。」
translation: He who treats them as they are, pratyekabuddha."

source_sentence: 佛在迦維羅衛國。
translation: The Buddha was in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 爾時釋摩男，請佛及僧明日食，佛默然受。
translation: It was then that Śāmāyana asked the Buddha and the saṃgha to eat tomorrow, and the Buddha accepted it in silence.

source_sentence: 釋摩男知佛默然受請已，頭面禮佛足右遶而去，還舍通夜辦種種多美飲食，早起敷坐處，遣使白佛：「時到，唯聖知時。」
translation: Knowing that the Buddha had accepted the invitation in silence, Śāmāyan bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, circled to his right, returned to his abode, prepared a variety of delicious foods throughout the night, got up early, prepared his sitting place, and sent a messenger to tell the Buddha, "The time has come; only the sages know the time."

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘以油塗足，是國多塵土著比丘脚，諸居士婦以兩手接比丘足作禮，然後洗手捉鉢下食。
translation: At the time, the monks smeared their feet with oil, and there were many dusty indigenous monks' feet in that country.

source_sentence: 有比丘語居士婦言：「先洗手已捉鉢。」
translation: One of the monks said to the householder woman, "First, wash your hands and grab your bowl."

source_sentence: 答言：「已洗。
translation: He replied, "I've washed it.

source_sentence: 若汝不油塗脚上來者，當有何過？」
translation: If you didn't rub oil on your feet, what would be wrong with you?"

source_sentence: 佛見居士婦呵責比丘作如是事。
translation: When the Buddha saw that the householder woman rebuked the monks for doing such a thing, he returned to the monastery after eating and gathered the monks for that purpose.

source_sentence: 佛食後還僧坊，以是事集比丘僧，語諸比丘：「從今不應以油塗足入白衣家。
translation: After he had eaten, the Buddha returned to the monastery, gathered the monks there because of this, and told the monks, "From now on, you shouldn't rub your feet with oil and enter a white-robed house.

source_sentence: 塗足入白衣舍者，突吉羅。
translation: Anyone who daubs their feet and enters the white-robed house will be excommunicated.

source_sentence: 若有泥有瘡塗入者，不犯。」
translation: If someone rubs mud or sores into it, it's not a violation."

source_sentence: 六群比丘油塗頭，諸居士呵責言：「諸沙門釋子自言：『善好有德。』
translation: Six groups of monks rubbed oil on their heads, and the householders rebuked them, saying, "Ascetics and Śākyamunis say to themselves, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 以油塗頭如白衣。」
translation: They rub oil on their heads like white robes."

source_sentence: 佛言：「從今不聽比丘以油塗頭。
translation: The Buddha said, "From now on, we won't hear monks rubbing oil on their heads.

source_sentence: 塗者，突吉羅。
translation: Rubbing it on is called tukhila.

source_sentence: 若新剃髮、若頭痛、若房舍內塗者，不犯。」
translation: If you apply it to freshly shaven hair, to a sore head, or inside a dwelling, it's not a violation."

source_sentence: 六群比丘莊嚴面目，諸居士呵責言：「諸比丘自言：『善好有德。』
translation: Six groups of monks adorned their faces, and the householders rebuked them, saying, "Those monks say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 莊嚴面目，如王、如大臣。」
translation: They adorn their countenance like a king or a minister."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不應莊嚴面目。
translation: They told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, you shouldn't adorn your countenance.

source_sentence: 莊嚴者，突吉羅。」
translation: That's adorned, duṣkṛta."

source_sentence: 六群比丘以莊嚴故畫眼。
translation: The six groups of monks painted their eyes in the name of adornment.

source_sentence: 諸居士呵責言：「諸比丘自言：『善好有德。』
translation: The householders rebuked them, saying, "Those monks say to themselves, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 畫眼如王如大臣。」
translation: They paint their eyes like kings and ministers."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不聽比丘為莊嚴故畫眼。
translation: They told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, we won't listen to monks who paint their eyes for the sake of being ornate.

source_sentence: 畫者，突吉羅。
translation: He who paints is a tukhila.

source_sentence: 畫眼有五種：一者墨畫、二者空青畫、三者雜畫、四者華畫、五者樹汁畫。
translation: There are five kinds of eye painting: first, ink painting, second, hollow blue painting, third, mixed painting, fourth, flower painting, and fifth, tree sap painting.

source_sentence: 若為治病故畫眼，不犯。」
translation: If someone paints their eyes to treat an illness, it's not a violation."

source_sentence: 六群比丘腕上繫縷，諸居士呵責言：「諸比丘自言：『善好有德。』
translation: Six groups of monks tied threads around their wrists, and the householders rebuked them, saying, "Those monks say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 以雜色縷繫腕上，如王、如大臣。」
translation: Tie thread of various colors around your wrists like a king or a minister."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不聽以雜色縷繫腕上。
translation: He told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, you won't be allowed to bind threads of various colors around your wrists.

source_sentence: 繫者，突吉羅。」
translation: Tie it, duṣkṛta."

source_sentence: 六群比丘縷絡腋，諸居士呵責言：「諸比丘自言：『善好有德。』
translation: Six groups of monks threaded their arms, and the householders rebuked them, saying, "Those monks say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 以縷絡腋如婆羅門。」
translation: Wrapping thread around your armpits is like a brāhmaṇa."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不聽比丘以縷絡腋。
translation: They told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, we won't listen to monks who wrap threads around their armpits.

source_sentence: 絡腋者，突吉羅。」
translation: Someone who wraps threads around his armpits is a tukhila."

source_sentence: 六群比丘畜莊嚴身具，諸居士呵責言：「諸沙門釋子自言：『善好有德。』
translation: Six groups of monks were reprimanded by the householders for having ornamented bodily implements, saying, "Ascetics and sons say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 畜莊嚴身具自莊嚴身，如王、如大臣。」
translation: They are like kings and ministers who have their own adorned bodies and adorn themselves with the ornamented bodily implements."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不聽比丘畜莊嚴身具。
translation: He told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, I won't listen to monks who are storing ornamented bodily implements.

source_sentence: 畜者，突吉羅。」
translation: He who stores them is a tukhila."

source_sentence: 六群比丘以臂釧自莊嚴，佛言：「不應畜臂釧自莊嚴。
translation: Six groups of monks adorned themselves with armlets, and the Buddha said, "You shouldn't store armlets to adorn yourself.

source_sentence: 畜者，突吉羅。」
translation: That's a tukhāra."

source_sentence: 六群比丘著指環，如王、如大臣。
translation: The six groups of monks wore finger-rings like kings and ministers.

source_sentence: 佛言：「不應著指環。
translation: The Buddha said, "You shouldn't wear finger-rings.

source_sentence: 著者，突吉羅。」
translation: Those who wear them, duṣkṛas."

source_sentence: 六群比丘著瓔珞，佛言：「比丘不應著瓔珞。
translation: Six groups of monks wear diadems, and the Buddha says, "A monk shouldn't wear diadems.

source_sentence: 著者，突吉羅。」
translation: Put them on, duṣkṛta."

source_sentence: 六群比丘著縷臂釧，佛言：「比丘不應著縷臂釧。
translation: Six groups of monks were wearing threaded armlets, and the Buddha said, "A monk shouldn't wear a threaded armlet.

source_sentence: 著者，突吉羅。」
translation: Put them on, pratyekabuddha."

source_sentence: 六群比丘以金銀鎖鑷穿耳，佛言：「不得以鎖鑷穿耳。
translation: Six groups of monks pierced their ears with gold and silver tweezers, and the Buddha said, "You mustn't pierce your ears with tweezers.

source_sentence: 穿耳者，突吉羅。」
translation: Those who pierce their ears will be made to wear them, tukhila."

source_sentence: 長老跋提，本白衣時著葡萄葉鑷，作比丘已本習氣故，猶故著之。
translation: The elder Bhadrika, who used to wear tweezers made of grape leaves when he was originally clothed in white robes, continued to wear them because of past karmic impressions after becoming a monk.

source_sentence: 諸居士呵責言：「是比丘著葡萄葉鑷，如王、如大臣。」
translation: The householders rebuked him, saying, "That monk is wearing tweezers made of grape leaves like a king or a minister!"

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不應著。
translation: He told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, you shouldn't put them on.

source_sentence: 著者，突吉羅。」
translation: Putting them on, that monk is a tukhila."

source_sentence: 佛遮一切莊嚴具故，六群比丘便以幣、帛繩、樹葉、樹皮、木、白鑞、鉛錫作耳圈著，諸居士言：「汝等不著金銀葉鑷，何用圈耳為？」
translation: When the Buddha had removed all the ornaments, the six groups of monks then put coins, strings of silk, leaves, bark, wood, pewter, and lead pewter in their ears, and the laymen said, "Why don't you put tweezers of gold and silver leaves in your ears?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「從今不聽比丘以幣、帛繩、樹葉、樹皮、木、白鑞、鉛錫作耳圈著。
translation: The Buddha said, "From now on, a monk won't be allowed to use coins, strings of silk, leaves, bark, wood, pewter, or lead pewter to make earrings.

source_sentence: 著者，突吉羅。
translation: A monk who puts them on is a tukhila.

source_sentence: 乃至以草簪穿耳孔中者，突吉羅。」
translation: Even if he puts a straw pin through the hole in his ear, that's a tukhāra."

source_sentence: 爾時六群比丘著耳環，佛言：「不應著耳環。
translation: It was then that six groups of monks were wearing earrings, and the Buddha said, "You shouldn't wear earrings.

source_sentence: 著者，突吉羅。」
translation: Putting them on, that's a tukhāra."

source_sentence: 又六群比丘畜約髮寶物。
translation: Another six groups of monks were storing valuable things made of hair.

source_sentence: 諸居士呵責言：「諸沙門釋子自言：『善好有德。』
translation: The householders rebuked them, saying, "Ascetics and Śākyamunis say to themselves, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 畜約髮寶物，如王、如大臣。」
translation: They store valuable things with their hair like kings and ministers."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今不應畜約髮寶物。
translation: They told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, you shouldn't store precious things with your hair.

source_sentence: 畜者，突吉羅。」
translation: That's a tukhāra."

source_sentence: 又六群比丘著金鬘。
translation: There were six groups of monks who wore gold garlands.

source_sentence: 諸居士呵責言：「沙門釋子自言：『善好有德。』
translation: The householders rebuked them, saying, "The ascetic Śākyamuni says to himself, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 著金鬘如王如大臣。」
translation: He wears a gold garland like a king or a minister."

source_sentence: 佛言：「比丘不應著金鬘。
translation: The Buddha said, "A monk shouldn't wear a gold garland.

source_sentence: 著者，突吉羅。」
translation: Those who wear them are tukhilas."

source_sentence: 又六群比丘治爪使白，佛言：「不應治爪使白。
translation: Six groups of monks also made their nails white when the Buddha said, "You shouldn't make your nails white.

source_sentence: 治者，突吉羅。」
translation: He who heals them, that's a tukhila."

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，爾時諸比丘入王舍城乞食，得菴羅果、菴羅果羹。
translation: When the Buddha was in Rājagṛha, the monks went into Rājagṛha to solicit alms and were given fruit of mango and fruit of mango soup.

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「佛不聽我等受菴羅果、菴羅果羹。」
translation: The monks said, "The Buddha won't listen to us as we accept the fruit of amla and the soup of amla."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「從今聽比丘受菴羅果、菴羅果羹。」
translation: They told the Buddha about this, and he said, "From now on, we'll listen to the monks accepting the fruit of amla and the soup of amla."

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，爾時瓶沙王有菴羅樹常生果，王信敬佛法故問諸比丘：「食菴羅果不？」
translation: When the Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha, the king of Vaiśravaṇa had a mango tree that always produced fruit. The king believed and respected the Buddha's teaching, so he asked the monks, "Will you eat the fruit of mango?"

source_sentence: 答言：「食。」
translation: He replied, "Eat."

source_sentence: 王言：「食我此菴羅樹果。」
translation: The king said, "Eat this fruit of my amla tree."

source_sentence: 是守果人不信敬佛法，有黃熟好果，留作王分及夫人王子大臣大官分；此果中有生者、青者、瘀者、虫鳥所落者，持與比丘。
translation: That fruit keeper didn't believe in or respect the Buddha's teaching, so he saved some good yellow fruit for the king's share and for the portions of wives, princes, ministers, and high-ranking officials; among that fruit, there were some that were raw, some that were green, some that were bruised, and some that had fallen from insects and birds, and he gave them to the monks.

source_sentence: 六群比丘到是處，取黃熟好果已，語守果人：「授與我來。」
translation: Six groups of monks went there, took the good yellow fruit, and said to the fruit keeper, "Give it to me."

source_sentence: 是人答言：「汝等已取，何須更受？」
translation: He replied, "You've already taken it; why do you need to accept it again?"

source_sentence: 是中有比丘少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜，向佛廣說。
translation: One of those monks, who was practicing the ascetic practice of having few desires and being satisfied, heard about this and wasn't pleased at heart, so he explained it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛以是因緣集比丘僧，集比丘僧已，問六群比丘：「汝實作是事不？」
translation: It was for this reason that the Buddha gathered the monks together, and after he had gathered the monks together, he asked six groups of monks, "Is this really what you do?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實作。
translation: He replied, "It's really done.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛以種種因緣呵責六群比丘：「云何名比丘，先自觸菴羅果，然後從淨人受噉？
translation: The Buddha rebuked six groups of monks for various reasons, "What is the name of a monk who first touches the fruit of maṇḍala himself and then eats it from a pure person?

source_sentence: 從今比丘，若自手觸菴羅果，後從淨人受者不應食。
translation: From now on, a monk who touches the fruit of ambrosia with his own hand and later receives it from a pure person shouldn't eat it.

source_sentence: 食者，突吉羅。
translation: If he eats it, he'll be surprised.

source_sentence: 如菴羅果，餘一切果亦如是。」
translation: As with the fruit of amla, so with all the other fruits."

source_sentence: 佛在舍衛國。
translation: The Buddha was in the country of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時憍薩羅國波斯匿王，遣使至瓶沙王所，讚歎波斯匿王言：「我王善好有福德，四瓶自然有乳滿，以供王飲；自然粳米日滿八斗器，以供王食。」
translation: It was then that King Prasenajit of Kauśālā sent an envoy to King Prasenajit to praise him, saying, "My king is so good and virtuous that he naturally fills four jars with milk for the king to drink and naturally fills eight buckets with millet each day for the king to eat."

source_sentence: 瓶沙王亦自讚歎己國：「我此土有菴羅果常生，樹提居士樹果生妙衣。」
translation: King Bimbisāra also praised his own country, saying, "Here in my land, the fruit of the mango tree always grows, and the fruit of the Jyotiṣka tree produces marvelous clothing."

source_sentence: 瓶沙王即遣信勅守園人，送菴羅果。
translation: King Bimbisāra then sent a message to the park keeper to send him the fruit of the amla.

source_sentence: 守園人作是念：「以此沙門取果因緣故，世尊必遮比丘噉菴羅果。」
translation: The park keeper thought, "Because this ascetic takes the cause and conditions of the fruit, the Bhagavān will prevent the monk from eating the fruit of the āmra."

source_sentence: 守園人即語王使言：「此園無有菴羅果，所有果沙門釋子先已噉盡。」
translation: The park keeper then told the king's envoy, "There's no fruit of amla in this garden; the ascetic and the monk had already eaten all of it."

source_sentence: 使還白王：「守園人言：『所有菴羅果，沙門釋子先已噉盡。』」
translation: The envoy also told the king, "The park keeper said, 'The ascetic and Śākyamuni devoured all the fruit of the āmra before him.'"

source_sentence: 王言：「我亦自知此非果時。
translation: The king said, "I also knew this wasn't the fruit when it was present.

source_sentence: 若少多有者，可示彼使令知相貌。」
translation: If there's a little or a lot of it, you can show the messenger its appearance."

source_sentence: 守園人得少多果已，往送奉王。
translation: After the park keeper obtained the fruit of little and much, he went to the king and presented it to him.

source_sentence: 有比丘少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜，呵責言：「云何名比丘，噉菴羅常生果，令灌頂王自遣使索不得？」
translation: A monk who was practicing the ascetic practice of having few desires was displeased when he heard this, and he rebuked him, saying, "Who is this monk who devoured the everlasting fruit of amla so that the king of Gandhāra couldn't get his own envoy to ask for it?"

source_sentence: 呵責已以是事白佛。
translation: After he rebuked them, he told the Buddha about this.

source_sentence: 佛以是因緣集比丘僧，集僧已佛種種因緣呵責：「云何名比丘，噉菴羅常生果，令灌頂王自遣使索不得？」
translation: The Buddha gathered the monks for this reason, and after he gathered the monks, the Buddha rebuked them for various reasons, "What's the name of a monk who eats the fruit of immortality that the king of consecration himself can't send his messengers to get?"

source_sentence: 種種因緣呵責已，語諸比丘：「從今菴羅常生果不應噉。
translation: After he rebuked them for various reasons, he told the monks, "From now on, the fruit of maṇḍala's constant birth shouldn't be devoured.

source_sentence: 噉者，突吉羅。」
translation: If you do, you'll be destined to eat it."

source_sentence: 佛在舍衛國。
translation: The Buddha was in the country of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘入舍衛國乞食，得菴羅羹。
translation: At the time, some monks went into Śrāvastī to solicit alms, and they were given some amla soup.

source_sentence: 諸比丘疑不受，作是念：「我等將不墮乞美食耶？」
translation: The monks doubted accepting it and thought, "Will we not fall back on this begging for food?"

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「若不索他自與，得取。」
translation: He told the Buddha about this, and he said, "If you don't ask others to give to you, you'll be able to take it."

source_sentence: 憍薩羅國一住處僧得施果，諸比丘不知云何？
translation: What did the monks at a residence in Kośala obtain as a result of their generosity that the monks didn't know about?

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「應以五種作淨噉。
translation: He told the Buddha about this, and he said, "There are five things you should do to purify your mouth.

source_sentence: 何謂為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 火淨、刀淨、爪淨、鸚鵡淨、子不生淨。」
translation: Fire is purified, the sword is purified, the claws are purified, the parrot is purified, and the son is purified of not being born."

source_sentence: 佛在芻摩國。
translation: The Buddha was in the country of Kuma.

source_sentence: 爾時阿那律共行弟子口乾病，醫師教含阿摩勒，口可得差。
translation: At the time, Aniruddha's fellow practitioners were suffering from dry mouth, and the physician taught them to take amalā, so their mouths could be cleared.

source_sentence: 弟子答言：「佛未聽我含阿摩勒。」
translation: The disciple replied, "The Buddha hasn't heard me embrace amalā."

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「聽比丘口病含阿摩勒。
translation: He then told the Buddha about it, and he said, "I've heard a monk with a dry mouth contain amalā.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 口乾病相宜故。」
translation: That's because it's appropriate for a dry mouth."

source_sentence: 有憍薩羅國一住處僧得施果，從淨人受未作淨，諸比丘不知云何？
translation: Monks in a monastery in Kośala who have attained the fruit of charity receive it from a pure person who has yet to purify it, but don't the monks know what it is?

source_sentence: 是事白佛，佛言：「應食外膚，莫食子。」
translation: He told the Buddha about this, and he said, "You should eat the skin of outsiders, not the children."

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城。
translation: The Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時樹提居士舉物，客從海中還持一栴檀段，餉樹提居士。
translation: It was then that the householder Jyoti gathered his things, and a visitor returned from the ocean with a piece of sandalwood to give to the householder Jyoti.

source_sentence: 居士大富，多金銀、珍寶、車璩、馬瑙、珊瑚等無量。
translation: The householder was very wealthy and had a great deal of gold, silver, jewelry, carabiners, coral, and countless other things.

source_sentence: 得是栴檀不以在意，即使作栴檀鉢著絡囊中，懸高象牙杙上。
translation: He didn't think twice about obtaining this sandalwood, so he made a sandalwood bowl, put it in a lining bag, and hung it high on an ivory post.

source_sentence: 作是言：「若沙門、婆羅門不以梯杖能得者便取。」
translation: He said, "Suppose an ascetic or a brāhmaṇa doesn't use a ladder and stick to get it, then he takes it."

source_sentence: 爾時富樓那迦葉，聞樹提居士為我故作栴檀鉢，即往問言：「汝為我作栴檀鉢耶？」
translation: It was then that Pūrṇa-kāśyapa heard that the monk Jyoti had made a sandalwood bowl for me, so he went to him and asked, "Did you make a sandalwood bowl for me?"

source_sentence: 居士答言：「我作栴檀鉢懸高象牙杙上，沙門、婆羅門不以梯杖能得者與。」
translation: The monk replied, "I'll make a sandalwood bowl and hang it on a high ivory tether, and an ascetic or a brāhmaṇa who doesn't use a ladder or a staff will get it."

source_sentence: 富樓那作是念：「居士欲見神通力。」
translation: Pūrṇa then thought, "The householder wants to see the powers of the supernormal powers."

source_sentence: 即挑頭而去。
translation: He picked his head up and departed.

source_sentence: 摩伽梨俱賒子、珊闍耶毘羅荼子、尼揵陀若提子、迦求陀迦旃延、阿耆陀翅舍欽婆羅，聞樹提居士為我作栴檀鉢，往詣其所問言：「汝為我作栴檀鉢耶？」
translation: When the sons Mahākauṣṭhila, Sañjayī-vairāḍana, Nirgrantha-jñāniputra, Kakuda-kātyāyana, and Ajita-keśaṇa-kambala heard that that monk Jyoti had made a sandalwood bowl for me, they went to him and asked, "Did you make a sandalwood bowl for me?"

source_sentence: 居士言：「我作栴檀鉢懸高象牙杙上，沙門、婆羅門不以梯杖能得者與，非不與。」
translation: The monk said, "I'll make a sandalwood bowl and hang it on a high ivory tether, and it won't be given by an ascetic or a brāhmaṇa who doesn't use a ladder and stick to get it."

source_sentence: 皆作是念：「是居士欲見神通力故。」
translation: They all thought, "That's because the householder wants to see the power of the superknowledge."

source_sentence: 挑頭而去。
translation: They picked their heads and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時長老賓頭盧頗羅墮，聞樹提居士作栴檀鉢絡囊盛懸高象牙杙上，沙門、婆羅門不以梯杖能得者與，非不與。
translation: It was then that the elder Piṇḍolabbaradvāja heard that the householder Jyoti had made a sandalwood bowl and a bag to hang it on a high ivory tether, and that the ascetics and priests would accept it unless they could get it with a ladder and stick, not unless they accepted it.

source_sentence: 聞已詣目連所言：「長老目連！
translation: After hearing this, he went to Maudgalyāyana and said, "Elder Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 汝知不？
translation: Do you know?

source_sentence: 樹提居士作栴檀鉢絡囊盛懸高象牙杙上，作是言：『諸沙門、婆羅門不以梯杖能取者與，非不與。』」
translation: The monk Jyoti made a sandalwood bowl and hung it in a bag on a high ivory tether and said, 'Suppose you were to give it to an ascetic or a brāhmaṇa who doesn't take it with a ladder and stick, or you wouldn't give it to him.'

source_sentence: 目連言：「汝師子吼中第一，便可往取。」
translation: Maudgalyāyana said, "You're the best among lions in terms of roaring, so go ahead and take it."

source_sentence: 爾時長老賓頭盧頗羅墮，過夜中前著衣持鉢，以好威儀行住坐立，往詣樹提居士舍。
translation: It was then that the elder Piṇḍolabbaradvāja put on his robe and bowl in the middle of the night, walked, stood, and sat with good manners, and went to the house of Jyotiṣka.

source_sentence: 樹提居士遙見賓頭盧行住坐立威儀清淨著衣持鉢，作是念：「如是比丘行住坐立威儀清淨著衣持鉢，必能取鉢。」
translation: From a distance, the monk Jyoti saw Piṇḍola walking, standing, sitting, and standing with proper deportment, wearing his robe and carrying his bowl, and he thought, "Such a monk walking, standing, sitting, and standing with proper deportment, wearing his robe and carrying his bowl, will surely be able to take his bowl."

source_sentence: 居士即從坐起，偏袒右肩、合掌向賓頭盧言：「善來頗羅墮！
translation: The monk then got up from his seat, bared his right shoulder, put his palms together, and said to Piṇḍola, "Good for you, Bālāditya!

source_sentence: 久不來此。」
translation: He hadn't been here for a long time."

source_sentence: 命就座坐，樹提居士頭面禮頗羅墮足，賓頭盧坐已問居士言：「汝實作栴檀鉢盛絡囊中懸高象牙杙上作是言：『諸沙門、婆羅門不以梯杖能取者與，非不與。』」
translation: He was told to sit down, and the monk Jyoti bowed his head to the feet of Bālāditya. After he sat down, Piṇḍola asked the monk, "Did you really make a sandalwood bowl, put it in a lining bag, and hang it high on an ivory tether, saying, 'Ascetics and priests don't take what they can get with a ladder and stick; they don't not take it.'"

source_sentence: 答言：「實爾。」
translation: He replied, "Indeed."

source_sentence: 賓頭盧即入如是禪定，便於座上申手取鉢以示居士。
translation: After he had thus concentrated, Piṇḍola then took his bowl from his seat and showed it to the householder.

source_sentence: 居士語言：「如我先語，即便屬汝。」
translation: The householder said, "As I said before, it will be yours."

source_sentence: 居士又言：「暫與我來。」
translation: The householder then said, "Come with me for a moment."

source_sentence: 即取鉢入，盛滿粳米飯授與賓頭盧。
translation: He then took his bowl, filled it with millet rice, and gave it to Piṇḍola.

source_sentence: 賓頭盧食已，便持是鉢示諸比丘言：「汝等看是鉢香好可愛。」
translation: After he had eaten, Piṇḍola then took this bowl and showed it to the monks, saying, "Look at the lovely fragrance of this bowl."

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「實爾！
translation: The monks said, "Indeed!

source_sentence: 從何處得？」
translation: Where did you get it?"

source_sentence: 賓頭盧廣說上事。
translation: Piṇḍola explained the above matter in detail.

source_sentence: 是中有比丘少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜，種種因緣呵責言：「云何名比丘，為赤裸外道物故，未受大戒人前，現過人聖法？」
translation: One of those monks, who was practicing the ascetic practice of having few desires and being satisfied, was displeased when he heard this, and he was rebuked for various reasons, saying, "What is the name of a monk who, because he's naked and a non-Buddhist, displays holy qualities that are beyond those of a human being before a person who hasn't received the great precepts?"

source_sentence: 呵已向佛廣說。
translation: After he had spoken to the Buddha, he explained it in detail.

source_sentence: 佛以是事集比丘僧，知而故問賓頭盧頗羅墮：「汝實作是事不？」
translation: Knowing this, the Buddha gathered the monks and therefore asked Piṇḍolabbaradvāja, "Is this really what you do?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實作。
translation: He replied, "It's really done.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛種種因緣呵責賓頭盧：「云何名比丘，為赤裸外道物木鉢故，於未受大戒人前現過人聖法？」
translation: The Buddha rebuked Piṇḍola for various reasons, "What is the name of a monk who, because of a wooden bowl made of naked non-Buddhist goods, shows an exceedingly noble dharma to someone who has not yet received the great precepts?"

source_sentence: 呵責已語頗羅墮：「盡形壽擯汝，不應此閻浮提住。」
translation: After he rebuked him, he said to Bālāditya, "I'll leave you here for the rest of your life, for you shouldn't stay in Jambudvī."

source_sentence: 賓頭盧受佛教已，頭面禮佛足右遶還自房，所受僧臥具床榻盡以還僧。
translation: After he had accepted the Buddha's teaching, Piṇḍola bowed his head to the Buddha's feet, circled to his right, and returned to his room, returning all the monks' bedding and sofas that he had accepted.

source_sentence: 持衣鉢入如是定，於閻浮提沒瞿耶尼現，到已多教化優婆塞、優婆夷，多畜弟子，起僧坊房舍，畜共行弟子、近行弟子，廣宣佛法。
translation: He took his robe and bowl and entered this concentration. He left for Goyānī in Jambudvī and taught many laymen and laywomen there, built a residence for the saṃgha, gathered co-disciples and near-disciples, and taught the Buddha's teachings.

source_sentence: 佛爾時遣賓頭盧去不久集比丘僧，集僧已語諸比丘：「從今不聽畜八種鉢。
translation: The Buddha then sent Piṇḍola away to assemble a monastery of monks shortly thereafter, and after assembling the monks, he told the monks, "From now on, you won't be allowed to store eight kinds of bowls.

source_sentence: 何等八？
translation: What are the eight?

source_sentence: 金鉢、銀鉢、琉璃鉢、摩尼珠鉢、銅鉢、白鑞鉢、木鉢、石鉢。
translation: It's a gold bowl, a silver bowl, a beryl bowl, a maṇi-jewel bowl, a brass bowl, a pewter bowl, a wooden bowl, or a stone bowl.

source_sentence: 畜者，突吉羅。
translation: Those who store them, duṣkṛta, will hear you store two kinds of bowls: iron bowls and tile bowls.

source_sentence: 聽汝等畜二種鉢：鐵鉢、瓦鉢。」
translation: I've heard you store two kinds of bowls: iron bowls and tile bowls."

source_sentence: 瓦鉢喜破，佛言：「綴用。」
translation: The tile bowl was delightfully broken, and the Buddha said, "Use it for decoration."

source_sentence: 優波離問佛：「以何物綴？」
translation: Upāli asked the Buddha, "What will you wrap it with?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「應用毛、芻摩、劫貝、麻、文闍草、婆婆草。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Apply hair, digit, kapok, hemp, munja grass, and pārśva grass."

source_sentence: 彼國多熱故，綴中生虫。
translation: Because of the heat in that country, insects grow in the binders.

source_sentence: 佛言：「應解綴，曬已還綴。」
translation: The Buddha said, "You should untie them and return them after drying them."

source_sentence: 諸比丘日日解曬還綴疲極。
translation: The monks were tired of uncoating and recoating day after day.

source_sentence: 有一比丘能鍛銅，是比丘白佛言：「願聽以二種物綴鉢：若鐵、若銅。」
translation: There was a monk who could forge copper. That monk said to the Buddha, "May I accept two things for my bowl: iron and copper?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「聽用若鐵、若銅。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Let's use iron or copper."

source_sentence: 佛在舍衛國。
translation: The Buddha was in the country of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時有比丘起欲心故，自截男根苦惱垂死。
translation: At the time, a monk cut off his own male faculty and died of suffering because he had become desirous.

source_sentence: 諸比丘以是事白佛，佛言：「汝等看是癡人！
translation: The monks told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said, "You see, you're deluded!

source_sentence: 應斷異，所斷異。
translation: What should be stopped is different, and what's stopped is different.

source_sentence: 應斷者，貪欲、瞋恚、愚癡。」
translation: Those that should be stopped are desire, anger, and folly."

source_sentence: 如是呵已語諸比丘：「從今不聽斷男根。
translation: After thus rebuking them, he told the monks, "From now on, I won't hear of cutting off the male faculty.

source_sentence: 斷者，偷蘭遮。」
translation: That's what should be stopped, Kauṇḍinya."

source_sentence: 復有比丘為作浴破薪故，毒蛇從朽木中出囓比丘指。
translation: Another monk was about to make a bath and break firewood when a viper emerged from rotten wood and bited the monk's finger.

source_sentence: 比丘作是念：「此毒必入身。」
translation: The monk thinks, "This poison will surely enter his body."

source_sentence: 即自斷指，由是指撅。
translation: He then cut off his own finger, and it puckered.

source_sentence: 諸居士入寺中見比丘撅指，作是言：「沙門釋子亦有撅指。」
translation: When the householders entered the monastery and saw the monk's puckered fingers, they said, "The ascetic Śākyamuni also has puckered fingers."

source_sentence: 是中有比丘少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜，是事白佛。
translation: One of those monks who was practicing the ascetic practice of having few desires and being satisfied was displeased when he heard this, and he told the Buddha about it.

source_sentence: 佛種種因緣呵責：「云何名比丘，自斷指？」
translation: The Buddha rebuked him for various reasons, "What do you call a monk who cuts off his own fingers?"

source_sentence: 如是呵已語諸比丘：「從今不應自斷指。
translation: After thus rebuking him, he told the monks, "From now on, you shouldn't cut off your own fingers.

source_sentence: 自斷指者，突吉羅。」
translation: Cutting off your own fingers is like a tukhāra."

source_sentence: 佛言：「從今有如是因緣，聽以繩纏指，以刀刺出毒。」
translation: The Buddha said, "From now on, for this reason, listen to this rope wrapped around your finger and a knife used to stab out the poison."

source_sentence: 有六群比丘往觀伎樂歌舞，諸居士呵責言：「諸沙門釋子自言：『善好有德。』
translation: Six groups of monks went to watch music, song, and dance, and the householders rebuked them, saying, "Ascetics and scholars say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 往觀聽伎樂歌舞，如王、如大臣。」
translation: They go to watch music, song, and dance like kings and ministers."

source_sentence: 是中有比丘少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜，是事白佛。
translation: One of those monks, who was practicing the ascetic practice of having few desires and being satisfied, heard about this and was not pleased at heart, and he told the Buddha about it.

source_sentence: 佛知故問六群比丘：「汝實作是事不？」
translation: Knowing this, the Buddha therefore asked the six groups of monks, "Is this really what you do?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實作。
translation: He replied, "It's really done.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛以種種因緣呵責言：「云何名比丘，自往觀聽伎樂歌舞？」
translation: The Buddha rebuked them for various reasons, saying, "What is the name of a monk who goes by himself to observe music, song, and dance?"

source_sentence: 如是呵已語諸比丘：「從今比丘不應往觀聽伎樂歌舞。
translation: After he thus rebuked them, he told the monks, "From now on, monks shouldn't go to observe music, song, and dance.

source_sentence: 往觀者，突吉羅。」
translation: Those who go there will be tukhilas."

source_sentence: 又六群比丘自歌，諸居士呵責言：「諸沙門釋子自言：『善好有德。』
translation: Six groups of monks also sang to themselves, and the householders rebuked them, saying, "Ascetics and sons say, 'Good, nice, and virtuous!'

source_sentence: 歌如白衣。」
translation: They sing like white robes."

source_sentence: 是中有比丘少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜，是事白佛。
translation: One of those monks, who was practicing the ascetic practice of having few desires and being satisfied, heard about this and was not pleased at heart, and he told the Buddha about it.

source_sentence: 佛語諸比丘：「從今不應歌。
translation: The Buddha said to the monks, "From now on, you shouldn't sing.

source_sentence: 歌者，突吉羅。
translation: That person who sings is a tukhila.

source_sentence: 歌有五過失：自心貪著；令他貪著；獨處多起覺觀；常為貪欲覆心；諸居士聞作是言：『諸沙門釋子亦歌，如我等無異。』
translation: There are five faults in singing: clinging to one's own mind, causing others to cling to one's own mind, creating numerous perceptions and contemplations when alone, and always being hindered by craving.

source_sentence: 復有五過失：自心貪著；令他起貪著；獨處多起覺觀；常為貪欲覆心；諸年少比丘聞亦隨學、隨學已常起貪欲心便反戒。」
translation: There are also five faults: clinging to one's own mind, causing others to cling to one's own mind, being alone, generating feelings and contemplations, and always being hindered by desire; and young monks who hear this also follow suit and, after following suit, always become desirous and then turn against the precepts."

source_sentence: 有比丘名跋提，於唄中第一，是比丘聲好，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: A monk named Bhadrika, the best in the chant, a monk of excellent reputation, said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願聽我作聲唄。」
translation: Please listen to me as I make a chant."

source_sentence: 佛言：「聽汝作聲唄。
translation: The Buddha said, "Listen to the sound of your chanting.

source_sentence: 唄有五利益：身體不疲、不忘所憶、心不疲勞、聲音不壞、語言易解。
translation: There are five benefits of chanting: the body doesn't tire, it doesn't forget what's remembered, the mind doesn't tire, the sound doesn't break, and the words are easy to understand.

source_sentence: 復有五利：身不疲極、不忘所憶、心不懈惓、聲音不壞、諸天聞唄聲心則歡喜。」
translation: There are another five benefits: the body doesn't tire, it doesn't forget what's remembered, the mind isn't fatigued, the voice doesn't break, and the gods rejoice when they hear the sound of the chant."

source_sentence: 佛在舍衛國。
translation: The Buddha was in the country of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘鐵鉢中食已，置鉢在地濕氣生壞，佛言：「從今聽用弊納著鉢下。」
translation: After the monks had eaten from an iron bowl and placed the bowl on the ground where moisture had grown and destroyed it, the Buddha said, "From now on, you must put your robe under the bowl."

source_sentence: 是國中多熱，納衣中生虫，佛言：「應作安鉢物。」
translation: It was hot in that country, and worms grew in their robes, so the Buddha said, "You should make a cloth to stabilize your bowl."

source_sentence: 長老優波離問佛：「以何物作安鉢物？」
translation: The elder Upāli asked the Buddha, "What will be used as a bowl-setter?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「應以白鑞、鉛、錫作。」
translation: The Buddha said, "You should make it out of pewter, lead, or tin."

source_sentence: 作已故生虫，佛言：「應作安鉢棧。」
translation: When worms appear after making it, the Buddha says, "You should make a pallet of storied food."

source_sentence: 作已瓦鉢棧上墮地破壞，佛言：「應著箱中。」
translation: After it was made, the tile pallet fell to the ground and broke, and the Buddha said, "You should put it in a box."

source_sentence: 露鉢著箱中相觸作聲，佛言：「聽以弊納裹著箱中。」
translation: When he put his bowl in the box and it made a sound when it touched, the Buddha said, "Listen, wrap this awful mess in the box."

source_sentence: 長老疑離越比丘，洗瓦鉢置日中日炙津出，語諸比丘：「瓦鉢不淨有膩，比丘不應用食。」
translation: The elder doubted that the monk Revata had washed the tile bowl, put it in the sun, and let the sun scorch it, and told the monks, "The tile bowl is impure and greasy, so the monks shouldn't use it for food."

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what to make of it.

source_sentence: 是事白佛。
translation: He told the Buddha about this.

source_sentence: 佛知故問疑離越：「汝實洗瓦鉢，置日中日炙津出，語諸比丘：『瓦鉢津膩不淨，比丘不應用食。』」
translation: Knowing this, the Buddha asked Doubting Lotus, "Did you really wash that tile bowl and put it in the middle of the sun to get the sun-scorching oil out of it and tell the monks, 'The tile bowl's oil is impure, so monks shouldn't use it to eat.'"

source_sentence: 答言：「實爾。
translation: He replied, "That's true.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛言：「從今洗瓦鉢已，不應著日中炙。
translation: The Buddha said, "From now on, after you wash your tile bowl, you shouldn't burn it in the middle of the sun.

source_sentence: 著日中者，突吉羅。」
translation: Putting it in the middle of the sun is a violation of the precepts, duṣkṛta."

source_sentence: 爾時比丘有貴價衣，水中浣淨欲裁作衣，以齒齧邊、若共挽裂，此衣處處縱橫破裂，佛言：「從今聽畜月頭刀子用裁衣。」
translation: It was then that a monk who had a valuable robe and had washed it in water and cleaned it wanted to cut it, but when he tore the edges with his teeth and pulled them together, the robe tore at every turn, and the Buddha said, "From now on, you must use a moon-headed knife to cut your robe."

source_sentence: 爾時以鷄毛、鳥毛縫衣，縫已易壞褰縮，佛言：「聽用二種針：鐵針、銅針，尖鼻、圓鼻、方鼻。」
translation: After sewing the robe with chicken or bird feathers, it tends to break and shrink, so the Buddha said, "You may use two kinds of needles: iron and copper, and pointed, round, and square noses."

source_sentence: 時諸比丘以衣著膝上縫，縫時皺，佛言：「敷地縫。」
translation: When the monks put their robes over their knees and sewed them together, the sewing process became wrinkled, and the Buddha said, "Lay out a ground seam."

source_sentence: 諸比丘敷地縫時土著，佛言：「當以牛屎塗地。」
translation: When the monks spread their seams on the ground, they became indigenous, and the Buddha said, 'Rub the ground with cow dung.'"

source_sentence: 時或有不正，佛言：「聽繩綴四邊。」
translation: When there's an incorrect fit, the Buddha says, "Listen, wrap the rope around the four sides."

source_sentence: 綴已或有不直，佛言：「處處拼拼。」
translation: When there's an inconsistency in the way it's wrapped, the Buddha says, 'Put it together everywhere.'

source_sentence: 時或有不均，佛言：「刻木為準。」
translation: When there's unevenness, the Buddha says, 'Carve the wood accordingly.'"

source_sentence: 縫時針難得前，指頭傷破，佛言：「聽著指[打-丁+沓]。」
translation: When sewing, it's difficult to get the needle in front of him, and his fingers are cut, and the Buddha says, "Listen to your fingers [beaten - d + tu]."

source_sentence: 爾時鍼刀指[打-丁+沓]木準，各著異處求覓難得，佛言：「聽以物盛著一處。」
translation: It was then that the needle, knife, fingers, and wood were correctly aligned, and each was placed in a different place where it was difficult to find it, and the Buddha said, "Listen, put something in one place."

source_sentence: 綴衣縫時喜壞衣緣，佛言：「聽著偽緣。」
translation: When he ties the seams of his robe, he likes to break the garment's edge, and the Buddha says, "Listen to the counterfeit edge."

source_sentence: 此衣舒在外邊喜失，佛言：「聽卷疊。」
translation: When this garment is stretched out to the outside, he likes to lose it, and the Buddha says, "Listen to it being folded."

source_sentence: 卷時喜舒，佛言：「以繩繫。」
translation: When it's rolled up, he likes to stretch it, and the Buddha says, 'Tie it with a cord.'"

source_sentence: 或時風雨污衣，佛言：「聽著覆處。」
translation: When the wind and rain sometimes defile the robe, the Buddha says, "Listen to the covering place."

source_sentence: 在覆處著地有虫噉，佛言：「聽打撅著壁上。」
translation: When it's covered and there are insects eating it, the Buddha says, 'Listen to that pout on the wall.'"

source_sentence: 時撅頭滑衣墮地，佛言：「聽作曲頭撅。」
translation: When his robe falls to the ground while he's pouting, the Buddha says, "Listen to him as he composes a pout."

source_sentence: 諸比丘身有長短，有短比丘截縫衣床就身，有長比丘更處處覓求長床，佛言：「聽鑿作孔盈兩頭出，令得共用。」
translation: When monks have long and short bodies, and a short monk sews his robe and bed to fit his body, and a long monk goes from place to place seeking a long bed, the Buddha says, "Dig a hole in it and make it fit both ends, so you can share it."

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，爾時六群比丘以鏡照面，佛言：「不聽照面。
translation: When the Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha, six groups of monks looked at their faces in mirrors, and the Buddha said, "I won't hear you look at your face.

source_sentence: 照面者，突吉羅。」
translation: Those who look at their faces are tukhilas."

source_sentence: 爾時六群比丘，或以鉢中照面、或水中照面，佛言：「若鉢中水中照面者，突吉羅。
translation: It was then that six groups of monks either looked at their faces in a bowl or in water, and the Buddha said, "Suppose someone looks at their face in water in a bowl, that's a prude.

source_sentence: 若照看面瘡者，不犯。」
translation: If someone were to look at their face in water, it wouldn't be a violation."

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，爾時六群比丘以梳梳頭，佛言：「比丘不得以梳梳頭。
translation: When the Buddha was in Rājagṛha, six groups of monks were combing their hair with a comb, and the Buddha said, "A monk shouldn't comb his hair with a comb.

source_sentence: 若梳頭者，突吉羅。」
translation: If he combs his hair, it's a grave offense."

source_sentence: 爾時六群比丘，又以刷刷頭，佛言：「若刷者，突吉羅。」
translation: It was then that six groups of monks were brushing their hair, and the Buddha said, "If they brush it, it's a tukhila."

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城。
translation: The Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時六群比丘，頂上留少髮，佛言：「不聽留。
translation: It was then that six groups of monks kept a little hair on their heads, and the Buddha said, "Don't listen to them.

source_sentence: 若留者，突吉羅。」
translation: If you leave it on, it's duṣkṛta."

source_sentence: 爾時六群比丘，留髮令捲，佛言：「不應留髮令捲。
translation: It was then that six groups of monks asked to curl their hair, but the Buddha said, "You shouldn't curl your hair.

source_sentence: 若留者，突吉羅。」
translation: If you do, it's a tukhāra."

source_sentence: 爾時六群比丘，留髮令長，佛言：「不應留髮令長。
translation: It was then that six groups of monks grew their hair long, and the Buddha said, "You shouldn't grow your hair long.

source_sentence: 若留者，突吉羅。
translation: If you do, it's a tukhāra.

source_sentence: 若阿練兒比丘，長至二寸，無罪。」
translation: If an arahant monk grows his hair up to two inches, he's not guilty."

source_sentence: 佛在舍衛國。
translation: The Buddha was in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時比丘有癩病、疥瘙病，語藥師耆婆：「治我病。」
translation: At the time, a monk with leprosy and scabies said to the healing physician Jīvaka, "Heal my illness."

source_sentence: 耆域言：「入浴室洗可差。」
translation: The jīva said, "Getting into a bathhouse and washing it can make a difference."

source_sentence: 比丘言：「佛未聽入浴室洗。」
translation: The monk said, "The Buddha hasn't heard of washing in a bathhouse."

source_sentence: 諸比丘以是事白佛，佛言：「聽入浴室洗。
translation: The monks told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said, "I've heard about washing in the bathhouse.

source_sentence: 洗有五功德：一者除垢、二者身清淨、三者除去身中寒冷病、四者除風、五者，得安隱。」
translation: Washing has five virtues: first, it removes dirt, second, it purifies the body, third, it removes the cold and sickness in the body, fourth, it removes wind, and fifth, it attains peace."

source_sentence: 爾時浴室中無有坐物，諸比丘無處可坐洗，佛言：「浴室中聽安坐物。」
translation: At the time, there were no sitting things in the bathhouse, and the monks had no place to sit and wash, so the Buddha said, "Listen to the sitting things in the bathhouse."

source_sentence: 長老優波離問佛：「用何物作？」
translation: The elder Upāli asked the Buddha, "What will be used for that?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「用木石塼作。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Use wood and stone to make it."

source_sentence: 爾時浴室地泥出，諸比丘以泥水洗，佛言：「聽浴室安橙。」
translation: When mud came out of the bathroom floor and the monks washed it with muddy water, the Buddha said, "Listen, put an orange in the bathroom."

source_sentence: 優波離問佛：「用何物作橙？」
translation: Upāli asked the Buddha, "What will you use to make oranges?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「以木石塼作。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Make it out of wood or stone."

source_sentence: 爾時當浴室中著火爐，諸比丘浴時不安隱，佛言：「應著壁安。」
translation: When a fireplace was placed in the bathroom and the monks became restless while bathing, the Buddha said, "Put it up against the wall."

source_sentence: 爾時不作竈，火炎直上至屋，佛言：「聽安竈。」
translation: It was then that the fire that hadn't been built reached the house, and the Buddha said, "Listen, set up the fireplace."

source_sentence: 竈中一時著薪，後比丘來洗時火勢已盡，佛言：「籌量著。」
translation: A firewood fire was once placed in the kitchen, and when the monks came to wash it, the fire had ended, and the Buddha said, "Measure it."

source_sentence: 爾時著長薪喜墮落，若以手舉便燒手，佛言：「以叉舉。」
translation: When he's standing on a long stick of wood, he's glad to fall; if he lifts it with his hand, it will burn his hand, and the Buddha says, "Lift it with a fork."

source_sentence: 當舉叉時，比丘頭上無髮熱痛，佛言：「以濕物覆頭。」
translation: When he lifts the fork, the monk's head is covered with hairless heat, and the Buddha says, "Cover your head with something wet."

source_sentence: 爾時須土塗身，佛言：「應畜盛土物。」
translation: It was then that he needed earth to coat his body, and the Buddha said, "You should store something that's full of earth."

source_sentence: 爾時須水，佛言：「應畜盛水器。」
translation: When there was a need for water, the Buddha said, "You should bring a dish to hold water."

source_sentence: 爾時水器小，佛言：「聽畜瓮。」
translation: When the water vessel was small, the Buddha said, "You must store an urn."

source_sentence: 瓮中盛滿水，爾時瓮水著竈埵上，有木薪墮上破瓮，佛言：「鑿壁安木著水瓮。」
translation: The urn was filled with water, and at the time, the water in the urn was placed on top of the āma and a wood firewood fell onto the urn and broke it, so the Buddha said, "Dig a wall and place wood on the urn."

source_sentence: 爾時瓮高，有比丘取水不及，佛言：「不應高安。」
translation: At the time, the urn was too high for a monk to reach for water, so the Buddha said, "It shouldn't be placed high."

source_sentence: 爾時安著下處，有比丘橖觸，佛言：「不得太下太高，齊肩齊頭安。」
translation: At the time, a monk put his foot down and touched it with his hand, and the Buddha said, "Don't put it too low or too high; put it shoulder to shoulder."

source_sentence: 時浴室無戶風入，佛言：「應安戶扇。」
translation: When there's no breeze coming from the door of the bathroom, the Buddha says, "You should put a fan in the door."

source_sentence: 時比丘入浴室時不得閉戶，佛言：「令一比丘看戶。」
translation: When a monk entered the bathroom, he couldn't close the door, and the Buddha said, "Have a monk watch the door."

source_sentence: 時浴室無窓故闇，佛言：「安窓。」
translation: When the bathroom was dark because there was no window, the Buddha said, "Install a window."

source_sentence: 時浴室無出烟處故熏黑，佛言：「施出烟處。」
translation: When the bathhouse was dark because there was no place for smoke to escape, the Buddha said, "Give him a place for smoke to escape."

source_sentence: 時比丘或有用澡豆、或有用土，以濕熱故，浴室虫生，佛言：「應蕩除令淨。」
translation: It was then that some monks used soap or dirt, and because of the heat and humidity, insects grew in the bathhouse, and the Buddha said, "Cleanse and purify it."

source_sentence: 爾時浴室中大有水，佛言：「應出水。」
translation: There was then a great deal of water in the bath, and the Buddha said, "The water should come out."

source_sentence: 出水時諸比丘吐悶或得病，佛言：「應安伏竇。」
translation: When the water rises, the monks may become stuffy or sick, and the Buddha says, "You should put a stall in the stall."

source_sentence: 伏竇中有蛇蝎、蜈蚣，來入螫諸比丘，佛言：「應織物遮水竇口。」
translation: When snakes and centipedes entered the calming dou and stung the monks, the Buddha said, "You should weave something to cover the mouth of the dou."

source_sentence: 爾時浴竟棄浴室去，後火燒浴室，佛言：「最後比丘應收諸物事，却瓮、却瓨滅火，閉戶下[橝-早+卑]乃去。」
translation: After he had finished bathing and had left the bathhouse, the fire then burned the bathhouse, and the Buddha said, "The last monk should put away the things, put out the urn and the container, extinguish the fire, and close the door and go under [śramaṇa+peh] before leaving."

source_sentence: 佛在維耶離，有一長者名大名梨昌，大富多饒財寶，大有田宅力勢。
translation: When the Buddha was at Vaiśālī, there was an elder named Dame Rizhao who was very wealthy and prolific in possessions and had great strength and power in his land.

source_sentence: 有一比丘，名迦留羅提舍，與是長者相識知舊出入往反。
translation: There was a monk named Kālodīśa who knew that elder and knew that he used to go back and forth.

source_sentence: 時迦留羅提舍，食時著衣持鉢持坐具，往大名梨昌所。
translation: At the time, Kālodīśa put on his robe and bowl and took his sitting cloth when he ate and went to the great monk Rizō.

source_sentence: 是梨昌遙見比丘來，讚言：「善來！
translation: Rizhao saw the monk coming from a distance and praised him, "Good boy!

source_sentence: 在此處坐。」
translation: Sit here."

source_sentence: 即敷坐具。
translation: He then spread out his sitting cloth.

source_sentence: 時大名梨昌，頭面禮足已一面坐。
translation: The Venerable Licchavi then bowed his head to his feet and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 比丘語大名梨昌：「今可往世尊所，向世尊作如是說：『云何比丘作非梵行？
translation: The monk said to the Venerable Rizhao, "Now, can you go to the Bhagavān and tell the Bhagavān this, 'How does a monk engage in a practice that's not religious?'

source_sentence: 是陀驃力士子共我婦作非梵行。』」
translation: 'This is the son of Dravya Rāṣṭrapāla who collaborated with my wife to engage in an unchaste practice.'"

source_sentence: 大名梨昌語迦留羅提舍：「云何以無根謗清淨比丘？」
translation: The great Vairocana spoke to Kālôditya, "How do you denigrate a pure monk because you have no faculties?"

source_sentence: 迦留羅提舍比丘語大名梨昌言：「若不向佛說此語者，不復與汝言語來往，不入汝舍。」
translation: The monk Kālôditya said to the Venerable Licchavi, "If I don't tell this to the Buddha, I won't again come or go with you in word or in word, and I won't enter your dwelling."

source_sentence: 大名梨昌與此比丘深相愛敬故，即作是念：「若我不作是語者，迦留羅提舍比丘必不共我語、不入我舍。」
translation: Because he and the monk had deep respect for each other, the Venerable Licchavi then thought, "If I don't say this, the monk Kālôditya will surely not speak with me or enter my dwelling."

source_sentence: 便語比丘：「我當向佛作是語。」
translation: He then said to the monk, "I will make this statement to the Buddha."

source_sentence: 是時大名梨昌往詣佛所白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The great man Licchavi then went to the Buddha and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何比丘作非梵行？
translation: How does a monk engage in an unchaste practice?

source_sentence: 是陀驃力士子共我婦作非梵行。」
translation: This is the son of Billitus who collaborated with my wife to engage in an impure practice."

source_sentence: 佛爾時語諸比丘：「汝等皆覆鉢，莫至是大名梨昌家。
translation: The Buddha then said to the monks, "Cover your bowls, and don't go to this house of the great Vairocana.

source_sentence: 諸比丘、比丘尼、式叉摩尼、沙彌、沙彌尼，不得到大名梨昌家自手受食。
translation: None of the monks, bhikṣus, nuns, śrāmaṇeras, or śrāmaṇerīs should go to the Tāmaṇerī Chang's house to receive food with their own hands.

source_sentence: 更有如是人，亦應與作覆鉢。
translation: Another such person should also cover his bowl.

source_sentence: 作覆鉢法者，一心和合僧，一比丘唱言：『大德僧聽！
translation: Those who do so will be united with the monks of one mind and one monk who calls out, 'Listen, great monks!'

source_sentence: 此大名梨昌誹謗比丘，是陀驃力士子清淨梵行，無根波羅夷謗。
translation: "This great renown Licchavi denigrated a monk who was a prince of the pure religious practice of the son of Prabhūtaratna and was denigrated by the Genneless Bālāśi.

source_sentence: 若僧時到僧忍聽，僧和合與是大名梨昌作覆鉢。
translation: If the saṃgha tolerates listening when it arrives, the saṃgha will combine with this great renown Licchavi to cover his bowl.

source_sentence: 諸比丘、比丘尼、式叉摩尼、沙彌、沙彌尼，不得至是家手受食，如是白。』
translation: None of the monks, nuns, nuns, novices, novices, or novices may go to that house and accept food from their hands, as I have explained.'

source_sentence: 白二羯磨。
translation: He explained it to the two karmas.

source_sentence: 『僧作覆鉢竟，僧忍，默然故，是事如是持！』」
translation: 'After the saṃgha made the covered bowl, the saṃgha tolerated it and remained silent, thus maintaining this!'

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘作如是念：「僧已為是大名梨昌覆鉢。
translation: The monks then had this thought, "The saṃgha has covered the bowl for this Dame Rizhao.

source_sentence: 諸比丘、比丘尼、式叉摩尼、沙彌、沙彌尼，不得至大名梨昌家手受食。」
translation: None of the monks, bhikṣus, nuns, śrāmaṇeras, or śrāmaṇerīs may go to the house of the Āryasiṃha to receive food in their hands."

source_sentence: 諸比丘復作是念：「誰能往長者家作如是言：『僧已覆鉢。
translation: The monks then thought, "Who can go to that elder's house and say, 'The saṃgha has covered his bowl?'

source_sentence: 一切比丘、比丘尼、式叉摩尼、沙彌、沙彌尼，不得至汝家手受食。』」
translation: All monks, bhikṣus, nuns, śrāmaṇeras, and śrāmaṇerīs mustn't go to your house to receive food in their hands.'"

source_sentence: 復作是念：「長老阿難是佛侍者，於諸比丘中讚歎清淨梵行，阿難能至是大名梨昌家，作如是言：『僧已作覆鉢，一切比丘、比丘尼、式叉摩尼、沙彌、沙彌尼，不復得至汝家手受食。』」
translation: Again, he thought, "The elder Ānanda, who was the Buddha's acolyte and who praised the pure religious practice among the monks, told Ānanda to go to the house of this great name Rizō and say, 'The saṃgha has covered your bowl, and no monk, bhikṣuṇī, Śākyamuni, śrāmaṇer, or śrāmaṇī can again go to your house and accept food with his hands.'"

source_sentence: 諸比丘共相謂言：「我等往至阿難所作是言：『僧已為大名梨昌作覆鉢，一切比丘、比丘尼、式叉摩尼、沙彌、沙彌尼，不得往大名梨昌家手受食。』」
translation: The monks said to each other, "We went to Ānanda and said, 'The saṃgha has made a covered bowl for the Śākyamuni, and no monk, bhikṣuṇī, Śākyamuni, or śrāmaṇerī can go to the Śākyamuni's house to receive food in his hand.'"

source_sentence: 諸比丘作是語已，往至阿難所，頭面禮足在一面坐已，白阿難言：「長老阿難！
translation: After the monks said this, they went to Ānanda, bowed their heads at their feet, sat down at one side, and said to Ānanda, "eldest Ānanda!

source_sentence: 僧已為大名梨昌作覆鉢，一切五眾不得往大名梨昌家手受食。
translation: After the saṃgha made a covered bowl for the Venerable Rizhao, all five congregations couldn't go to the Venerable Rizhao's house to receive food in their hands.

source_sentence: 我等心念：『誰能往長者家作是語：「眾僧為汝作覆鉢，一切五眾不得至汝家手受食。」』
translation: We thought, 'Who would go to that elder's house and say, 'The saṃgha has made a covered bowl for you, and all five of you mustn't go to your house to receive food in your hands?'

source_sentence: 諸比丘復作是念：『唯長老阿難是佛侍者，佛常於比丘眾中讚歎梵行清淨，堪任能往作是言：「僧今已為長者作覆鉢，一切五眾不得至汝家手受食。」』
translation: The monks then thought, 'Only eldest Ānanda, who is the Buddha's acolyte and who is always praised by the Buddha among the monks for his pure religious practice, is qualified to go to the elder's house and say, 'The saṃgha has now made a covered bowl for you, and all five of you won't be allowed to go to your house to receive food in your hands.'"

source_sentence: 長老阿難！
translation: Elder Ānanda!

source_sentence: 今可往大名梨昌家作是言：『僧已為汝覆鉢，一切五眾不復至汝家手受食。』」
translation: Now, you may go to the Dame Lichang's house and say, 'The saṃgha has covered your bowl, and all five of you will no longer come to your house to receive food in your hand.'"

source_sentence: 爾時阿難默然受。
translation: Ānanda then accepted it in silence.

source_sentence: 諸比丘見阿難受已，從坐起作禮右遶而去。
translation: After the monks saw Ānanda accept it, they got up from their seats, paid homage, circled to their right, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難過夜已，中前著衣持鉢至大名梨昌家。
translation: After he had passed the night, Ānanda put on his robe and took his bowl to the Venerable Rizhao's house.

source_sentence: 大名梨昌遙見阿難來，即從坐起，著衣在一處立，叉手言：「善來阿難！
translation: When the Venerable Licchavi saw Ānanda coming, he rose from his seat, put on his robe, stood at one place, and saluted him with his palms together, saying, "Good coming, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 就此處坐。」
translation: Sit here."

source_sentence: 阿難答言：「我不得坐。」
translation: Ānanda replied, "I won't be allowed to sit there."

source_sentence: 大名梨昌問言：「何故不得？」
translation: The great Vairocana asked, "Why can't I?"

source_sentence: 阿難言：「僧已為大名梨昌作覆鉢，一切五眾不得至汝家手受食。」
translation: Ānanda said, "The saṃgha has made a covered bowl for the Venerable Licchavi, so all five groups of people won't be allowed to come to your house to receive food in their hands."

source_sentence: 大名梨昌語阿難：「我今便為自損、功德不生。」
translation: The Venerable Licchavi said to Ānanda, "Now, I'll harm myself, and my virtue won't arise."

source_sentence: 阿難答言：「汝實自損、功德不生。」
translation: Ānanda replied, "You've really damaged yourself, and your virtue hasn't arisen."

source_sentence: 問阿難言：「我今可得往佛所仰鉢不？」
translation: He asked Ānanda, "May I now take my bowl to the Buddha's house?"

source_sentence: 阿難言：「不得。」
translation: Ānanda said, "No!"

source_sentence: 大名梨昌聞是語已，心愁迷悶躄地。
translation: After hearing those words, the Venerable Licchavi was distraught and confused, and he fell to the ground.

source_sentence: 大名梨昌婦扶頭起。
translation: The Venerable Licchavi's wife helped her head up.

source_sentence: 以水灑面久乃得醒。
translation: She sprinkled her face with water for a long time and then woke up.

source_sentence: 婦語大名梨昌：「正有是苦，更有過是苦耶？」
translation: The woman said to the Venerable Licchavi, "Is there more than this suffering that exists?"

source_sentence: 自言：「我無過罪，而面向佛說我過，於清淨比丘眾中我謗作非梵行。」
translation: He said, "I have no faults, yet I've faced the Buddha and told him about my faults, and I've denigrated the pure monks and engaged in conduct that's not the religious life."

source_sentence: 爾時大名梨昌，往詣佛所白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the great name Licchavi went to the Buddha and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願為我仰鉢。」
translation: Please raise your bowl for me."

source_sentence: 佛語諸比丘：「為是大名梨昌仰鉢。
translation: The Buddha said to the monks, "Raise your bowl for this great man named Licchavi.

source_sentence: 仰鉢法者，一心和合僧，是大名梨昌，偏袒右肩、合掌胡跪言：『眾僧憶念！
translation: The one who presents his bowl is the monk with the single-minded harmonization who is the great name Licchavi, who bares his right shoulder, joins his palms, kneels down, and says, 'Remember, all you monks!'

source_sentence: 我大名梨昌罵詈道說，比丘陀驃力士子清淨梵行人，我以無根非梵行故謗，僧作覆鉢，一切五眾不得至我家手受食。
translation: I, the great René Lichang, ridiculed the Way and said, 'The Bhikṣuṇḍarīka is a pure and religious practitioner, and I denigrate him because he has no faculties and doesn't engage in religious practices; the saṃgha covered his bowl, and all five of us couldn't come to my house to receive food in our hands.

source_sentence: 我今願眾僧還仰鉢，一切五眾如本往來我舍手受食，憐愍故！』
translation: Now, I wish that the saṃgha would return my bowl, and all five of them would come to me to receive food from my hand as before, out of pity!'

source_sentence: 如是三乞。
translation: Thus, he begged three times.

source_sentence: 一比丘應僧中唱言：『大德僧聽！
translation: One of the monks responded to the call from within the saṃgha, saying, 'Listen, great sir!

source_sentence: 是大名梨昌，罵詈道說，比丘陀驃力士子清淨梵行人，以無根波羅夷謗故，僧為作覆鉢，一切五眾不得往至大名梨昌家手受食。
translation: That was the Venerable Licchavi who ridiculed the Way and said that the Bhikṣuṇḍarīka was a pure religious practitioner who had been denigrated by the rootless Pārājika, so the saṃgha covered his bowl for him and all five groups of people were forbidden to go to the Venerable Licchavi's house to receive food in his own hands.

source_sentence: 若僧時到僧忍聽，為大名梨昌仰鉢，如本往來自手受食。
translation: If the saṃgha then arrives, the saṃgha tolerates hearing it and raises the bowl for the Dame Lichāna and takes the food in his own hands just as he had before.

source_sentence: 如是白。』
translation: He said, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 白四羯磨。
translation: He explained the four rules of karma.

translation: 'After the saṃgha had presented his bowl, the saṃgha tolerated it and silently maintained this!'
